page.title: 04Barrowby Church
page.content: Barrowby Church was built in about 1220 but there's evidence of a previous Saxon Church on the same site.In the tower there are six bells and the oldest dates from 1600 and was made in Nottingham. There are three services on Sunday and about a hundred people go to them.The Rector has been a rector since 1954 but not always at Barrowby Church.He has been at Barrowby since 1957.He wears different coloured clothes for the different seasons and for ordinary Sundays he wears green. Barrowby parish is much bigger than Barrowby.It covers the whole of Barrowby and some small farms and villages around.
